alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain were beginning to lift north of the Savannah River with only light to moderate rain remaining over the Savannah Metro Area. As much as 1.5 inches of rain has fallen in some areas this afternoon. An additional 0.25 inch could fall through 515 PM. Urban flooding is likely occurring in some areas. Be alert for flooded roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Hunter Army Airfield, Windsor Forest, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, Hutchinson Island, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Savannah International Airport, Wilmington Island, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff, Sandfly and Savannah Historic District.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
